Miss Ellen Smith
111 Hatton Street
Jackson
Tennessee
U.S.A.
Savilly France
Dear Ellen -
I received a letter from you last night Was real glad to here from you, although I was sorry to here you were sick I am feeling fine and lordy I thank the cold weather makes us feel better
This weather here is quite different from what it was in Nice I don't see why they didn't let me stay down there, where the weather is nice and warm
We have had a small snow since I got back but it is all gone now. I think it is too cold to snow now. And of course I am
driving a truck every day when I come in at night I sit around and hug a little stove until bed time.
Say if I were you I would run Mrs James and Havel out of town for bringing the flu back and giving it to you
Well I will try again I have had to stop writing three times I have just got back from a entertainment the 12 of of C put on Was real good
Was three men they travel from one place to another and entertain the soldiers.
I dont know what we would do if wasnt for some things like that to help us pass the time away.
I say you got some nice Xmas presents and there were so many of them.
I will say Bob beat them all with a diamond necklace I know you will love him most to death wont you? (Oh please dont) for that.
Well I havent any small firdues so cant send you one. But my be wont be long untill I will be home I hope so any way.
The days seem like weeks I I want to get home so bad Going home is all that the boys talk about or think about. I guess that is why the times passes so slow.
Say did Dean McDade ever get
over here. I dont see how he got home so quick if he was over here.

Do you still here from Esther and her mom. I wrote them a letter but never heard from them guess they never got it I have wrote more letters since I have been in the army than I would have written in ten years out.
But I have to write letters to get letters. I believe I would go crazy if I didnt get lots. I just cant tell you how different I do here after getting some mail.
Say Arr is in the hospital I think he had to lie a time on his fangloves guess he will soon be alright
Will us is most hard time for a soldier and I have to get up real early in the morning. Will quit for this time Write me real often for I am always real glad to get your letters.
With lots of love from
James L. Dodds
Truck Co #8 = 23 Engrs
American Exp Force
France
